result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Carl A Evrard in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Carl A Evrard in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 10-12-2016: COURT REPORTER EILEEN GRZENIA**

Defendant Carl A Evrard in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for status conference and continued bail forfeiture hearing.  Attorney Schwantes just found out that the discovery relating to the cell phone is now available.  Court grants Attorney Schwantes' request for a 10 day extension of the deadline for filing motions.  Court sets final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  The bail forfeiture will continue to track.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in court in custody with Atty T. Schwantes. Atty Necci and Intern A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes Filed.

** 12/9/16 CORRECTED Transcript Filed

Defendant Carl A Evrard in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney T.Schwantes. Daniel Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15CF138 AND 15GF514
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.E.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
